benchmark_details.name: IdentityChain
benchmark_details.overview: IdentityChain is a framework designed to evaluate the self-consistency and conventional accuracy of Code Large Language Models (LLMs), particularly in natural language to programming language (NL-to-PL) and programming language to natural language (PL-to-NL) generation tasks.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To evaluate and provide insights into the self-consistency of Code LLMs, identifying weaknesses in their performance.

data.size: 164 tasks for HumanEvalPlus, 974 tasks for MBPP

methodology.calculation: The accuracy is computed as a percentage based on correctly generated outputs compared to expected outputs.
methodology.interpretation: Higher scores indicate better self-consistency and model performance.
methodology.validation: Model performance is validated using a set of benchmark tasks and manual examination of outputs.
